synopsis: In episode #6 of Pineapple Blood Rotation, Devam and Ahir engage in a heartfelt discussion about self-worth, neuroticism, and the complexities of emotional growth. They share personal experiences and insights on navigating life's challenges, emphasizing the importance of understanding oneself and extending empathy to others.
quotes: Understanding your own pain is the first step to healing, and only then can you extend that understanding to others.
It’s so much better to finally get a grasp on your feelings than to be trapped in confusion.
You can’t truly be altruistic unless you first value yourself.
The problems that scare you most are often the ones that need to be acknowledged and faced.
Just because you're not consciously thinking about something doesn’t mean you’re not processing it.
Every experience is a part of who you are; don’t let your thoughts define you.
It’s okay to forget things; that means you're not clinging too tightly to your thoughts.
We are not our thoughts; we are our experiences.
You can't rush growth; it takes time to become the person you want to be.
Everyone has the capacity to change, and we should give each other the chance to grow.
